alert.note: Alert for Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 2:16PM EST until December 19 at 11:36AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Rhode Island... Massachusetts... Blackstone River At Woonsocket affecting Providence and Worcester Counties. For the Blackstone River...including Woonsocket...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Blackstone River at Woonsocket. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding may begin to affect the lower parking area to the Highland Falls Apartments. Lower lying residential areas along the Rhode Island and Massachusetts line, including the lower level of the 148 Bernon St Condominiums in Woonsocket, may begin to experience flooding. Businesses along the river should take the necessary actions to protect property. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 9.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday evening. late tonight at 230 AM EST.
